citation.article-title: Desulfacinum infernum gen. nov., sp. nov., a thermophilic sulfate-reducing bacterium from a petroleum reservoir.

p.s: Desulfacinum (De. sulf.a.ci'num. L. pref. de, from; L. n. sulfur, sulfur; L. n. acinum, a berry [especially a grape]; L. n. Desulfacinum, a berry-shaped sulfate-reducing bacterium)
Strict anaerobes which use sulfate as an electron acceptor; the sulfate is reduced to sulfide.
Nutritionally versatile, oxidizing a number of organic acids and alcohols.
The genus Desulfacinum belongs to the delta subunit of the Proteobacteria.
The closest relatives are Syntrophobacter wolinii and the genus Desulfomonile.
